Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a game on the server.
    Author:
    David Eriksson, Fredrik Lindahl

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a new game with the specified arguments.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(ConnectionHandler ch,
            int gameId,
            java.lang.String name,
            java.io.InputStream ois,
            java.io.OutputStream oos)
        Creates a new game with the specified arguments.
        Parameters:
        ch - The connection handler which the game has been called from.
        gameId - The id which the game has.
        name - The name of the first connected user.
        ois - The input stream of the first connected user.
        oos - The output stream of the first connected user.

    • Method Detail

      • addPlayer

        public boolean addPlayer(java.lang.String name,
                         java.io.InputStream ois,
                         java.io.OutputStream oos)
        Adds a new player into the game.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the player.
        ois - The input stream of the player.
        oos - The output stream of the player.
        Returns:
        Boolean of if the action was permitted or the lobby was full.

      • boundsDetection

        public boolean boundsDetection(Coordinate player)
        Checks if the player is on any edge.
        Parameters:
        player - The coordinates of the player which is to be checked.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the player is out of bounds.

      • collisionDetection

        public boolean collisionDetection(Coordinate a,
                                  Coordinate b)
        Checks if two coordinates collides with each other.
        Parameters:
        a - The first coordinate.
        b - The second coordinate.
        Returns:
        Boolean of which the two coordinates collides or not.

      • getPlayers

        public java.lang.String[] getPlayers()
        Gets all the player names within the current game.
        Returns:
        String list of all the player names.

      • hasBrokenRule

        public java.lang.String hasBrokenRule()
        Checks if a rule has been broken since last collision check.
        Returns:
        The rule which has been broken.

      • hasCollectedCoin

        public int hasCollectedCoin()
        Checks if a coin has been collected since last collision check.
        Returns:
        The coin id if a coin has been collected.

      • inProgress

        public boolean inProgress()
        Checks if the state of the game is in progress.
        Returns:
        Returns true if in progress otherwise false.

      • isAttacked

        public boolean isAttacked(Player p)
        Checks if pacman is attacked by one of the ghosts.
        Parameters:
        p - The player to be checked.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the player is standing on a ghost.

      • isCompleted

        public int isCompleted()
        Checks if the game is completed or is running currently.
        Returns:
        If the game is completed returns the type which won.

      • isOnCoin

        public int isOnCoin(Player p)
        Checks if a specified player is standing on a coin.
        Parameters:
        p - The player to be checked.
        Returns:
        Returns the coin id if the player is standing on a coin, otherwise -1.

      • removePlayer

        public void removePlayer(Player p)
        Removes a player from the current game.
        Parameters:
        p - The player which is suppose to be removed

      • startGame

        public org.json.JSONObject startGame(Player p,
                                     int mapId)
        Starts the game on a specified map if the player is pacman.
        Parameters:
        p - The player which is attempting to start the game.
        mapId - The map which the game shall be played on.
        Returns:
        The data provided from the map chosen.

      • updatePlayer

        public Coordinate[] updatePlayer(Player p)
        Updates the specified player and tells the other players that this player has updated.
        Parameters:
        p - The player which is getting updated.
        Returns:
        A list of all the players which the provided player has outdated coordinates of.
